Posts.Content: Originally Posted by njs I read as many of those journal papers as I could locate and I compiled my findings in a spreadsheet, which I have posted here as a Google Doc (please note that I have not updated this since 2013): https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets...kf2x9v15dm5LjY I'm having trouble seeing the percentages in your spreadsheet from the abstracts you reference. Can't see how to get to the actual paper, either, from your link in the spreadsheet. How/where did you find the positive margin percentages you have in your spreadsheet?
Posts.Signature: Age @ DX: 66 PSA 6/16/15 physical: 4.8, % free: 20%, DRE negative Follow-up PSA 7/7/15: 4.5, % free: 18.4%, URO DRE negative Biopsy 7/21/15, 3 cores positive: 46% (right apex), 5% (left apex), 1% (right lateral apex). All G6. Currently staged: T1c MRI not scheduled yet.
Posts.Title: Researching A Surgeon's Surgical Margin Rates

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by newporter PSA 2.5 in 2000, 8.4 in 6/09. Three negative biopsies in between. 6/10 PSA 10.7, biopsy 1 of 12 cores 5% cancer, Gleason 3+3 CT, bone scans & MRI all negative Da Vinci 8/10; nerve sparing, catheter out in 7 days; no incontinence, no ED Post Op Pathology pT2N0Mx: organ confined; negative margins; lymph nodes & seminal vesicle not involved but PNI present; cancer extensive within prostate, Did anyone ever give an explanation of how you could have so many negative biopsies, with the last one showing only one 5% core, and yet have extensive cancer within the prostate? Do you think the biopsies might not have been done properly?
Posts.Signature: Age @ DX: 66 PSA 6/16/15 physical: 4.8, % free: 20%, DRE negative Follow-up PSA 7/7/15: 4.5, % free: 18.4%, URO DRE negative Biopsy 7/21/15, 3 cores positive: 46% (right apex), 5% (left apex), 1% (right lateral apex). All G6. Currently staged: T1c MRI not scheduled yet.
Posts.Title: Researching A Surgeon's Surgical Margin Rates

Posts.Content: Many posters here recommend researching positive (or negative) surgical margin rates for evaluating a surgeon's skill. I would be particularly interested in researching their results with T1c cases, which is my current stage. I've tried many Google searches and several searches here in the PC Forum but am coming up with blanks. Can someone point me to where I can start researching published numbers for RALP surgeons? Are these kinds of numbers available only for "big time" surgeons who have tabulated their data and published a study?
Posts.Signature: Age @ DX: 66 PSA 6/16/15 physical: 4.8, % free: 20%, DRE negative Follow-up PSA 7/7/15: 4.5, % free: 18.4%, URO DRE negative Biopsy 7/21/15, 3 cores positive: 46% (right apex), 5% (left apex), 1% (right lateral apex). All G6. Currently staged: T1c MRI not scheduled yet.
